title: Hawaii County committee approves banning herbicide use
text:
HILO, Hawaii (AP) - A committee of the Hawaii County Council has approved a proposed ban on using herbicides on county property.

The Agriculture, Water, Energy and Environmental Management Committee voted Tuesday to forward the bill to the first of two required council hearings.

Officials say the ban would only apply to county agencies that maintain public areas, including parks, sidewalks and trails. Private property owners would not be affected.

The bill sponsored by Councilwoman Rebecca Villegas would ban the use of herbicides for four years in several categories of property owned by the county.

The areas include parks, roadsides, sidewalks, trails, drainageways, and waterways.

The proposal includes a list of specific chemicals to be banned.

The bill calls for a transition period starting in January and a complete ban implemented by 2024.
